messages: dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:22): gah, "hg" needed to download the latest source version? what happened to the good old svn days :(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:25): The good old svn days turned into the better new hg days
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:26): It's basically the same as SVN except you use the command "hg" instead of "svn" :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:26): ...although I suppose it might be a bit more painful on Windows
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:35): well, not really, seems to work exactly like it should
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:37): hmm... strange, it checked out the whole tree, even though I requested a subdirectory
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:41): hmm... "... you cannot check out only one directory of a repository"
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:47): hmm... I guess I can't clone the default repository and use that? seems that is 0.11 still. Maybe the 0.2 branch? *figures out how to clone a branch*
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:51): is that the latest version? or should I look into some other branch?
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:54): ah, fuck it, beautifulsoup seems deprecated anyways
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:55): dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff: Yeah, Hg doesn't support partial checkouts - you just clone the entire repository
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:55): yeah, I figured that out
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:55): which includes all the branches and everything
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:56): how do I know which the latest branch is?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:56): You should just use the default branch
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:56): since the others were for temporary experiments
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:57): I think the BS code is still included and should work better than the 0.11 release, though I could be wrong about that
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:58): seems I still get the same error there

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:58): but there are fundamental problems in BS that mean it can't work properly in html5lib, and nobody has been interested in spending a great deal of effort on it
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:58): but with an extra DataLossWarning
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (13:58): I'll just use something else then I guess
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:59): Okay, so maybe it doesn't work much better than the 0.11 release :-(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:00): lxml is usually the recommended treebuilder
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:01): ok, i saw the remark in the docs about lxml being an "excellent library" :)
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:01): or something in those terms
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:08): oh great, the lxml parser crashes on those sites too :(
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:08): Hmm, seems to work okay for me with lxml
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:09): (I can't test BS yet since I don't have it installed)
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:09): are you parsning http://www.allehanda.se ?
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:10): http://dpaste.com/123628/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:10): No, because that timed out when I first tried downloading it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:10): but now I see the problem :-/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:12): ihatexml.py lives up to its name
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:12): heh, great name for a file, what does it do?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:15): http://code.google.com/p/html5lib/issues/detail?id=125
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:15): ah, that seems it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:15): It tries to modify the names returned by the HTML parser so they're compatible with APIs that enforce XML's name requirements
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:16): (and similar things)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:20): dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff: <a><div><div><a> seems to be the pattern the BS treebuilder dislikes
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:21): heh, I can understand that
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:23): dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff: It's the same as http://code.google.com/p/html5lib/issues/detail?id=80
dbc957b8ae41419e5e3f1d3b6d3842ff (14:23): ah, good detective work
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:24): should have remembered it sooner because he looked into that bug when it was new
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (14:25): (At least that's the problem on www.unt.se, I assume the others are the same)
